Name: Fragment of a naophore
Description: This fragment of statuette of schist shows a kneeling person presenting a small naos in which we find a figurine of Osiris. The inscriptions on the dorsal pillar and on the socle  informs us that the owner was a certain Wahibre, "Chief of the stud-farm, the first one of his Majesy, true acquaintance of the king who loves him" son of Pediese. The piece, which belongs to a type of naophorous statues placed in sanctuaries as votive offerings, comes from Rohesau, near to Letopolis, and dates from the 26th Dynasty.
